meanings.definition: The first page of a newspaper or website.
meanings.sent1: I always check the frontpage of the newspaper for the latest news.
meanings.sent2: The frontpage of the website had a big headline about the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The frontpage of the newspaper seemed to shout out the breaking news.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the frontpage of a newspaper, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The frontpage of the website was like a window into the world of current events.

meanings.definition: To place on the first page of a newspaper or website.
meanings.sent1: The editor decided to frontpage the article about the charity event.
meanings.sent2: She frontpaged the breaking news story to grab readers' attention.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would frontpage his cat's antics in the newspaper.
meanings.sent4: The artist frontpaged her latest masterpiece on the gallery's website.
meanings.sent5: The team's victory was frontpaged on the sports section of the newspaper.
